Text: Audible warning devices Refer to: R28 00-S4
Effective date and Scope:

Effective date from 2019/1/1, the new types of audible warning devices used in category symbols M,N,L2, L3 and L5, and from 2021/1/1, all types of audible warning devices used in category symbols L2, L3 and L5, shall comply with this regulation.

Audible warning devices:
The audible warning devices fitted on category symbols M and N and motor cycles of a power greater than 7 kW (9.51 horsepower)
Measurement of the sound characteristics
Sound level:
This regulation applies to the audible warning device supplied with direct or alternating current or compressed air.

The audible warning device shall emit a continuous and uniform sound; its acoustic spectrum shall not vary substantially during its operation. For warning devices supplied with alternating current, this requirement shall apply only at constant generator speed.

The microphone shall be so placed that its diaphragm is at a distance of 2 ( 0.01) m from the plane of the sound outlet of the device. The device to be tested and the microphone shall be placed at the same height. This height shall be between 1.15 and 1.25 m. The background (ambient) noise level shall be at least 10 dB (A) lower than the sound pressure level to be measured.
Endurance:

In the case of AWDs supplied with direct current shall be supplied with current at a voltage measured at the terminal of the electric power source of 13/12 of the rated voltage and its the resistance of the connecting leads, expressed in ohms, including terminals and contacts, shall be as close as possible to (0.10/12) x rated voltage in volts. The supply voltage varies between 115% and 95% of its rated voltage.
For AWDs supplied with alternating current, the supply voltage varies between 50% and 100% of the maximum speed of the generator indicated by the manufacturer for continuous operation.

The test is performed for 50,000 times, each time for one second followed by an interval of four seconds. If, after the AWD has been operated for half the number of times prescribed, the sound level characteristics are no  longer the same as before the test, the AWD may be adjusted. After being operated the prescribed number of times, and after further adjustment if necessary, the AWD must pass the test. For warning devices of the electro-pneumatic type, the device may be lubricated with the oil recommended by the manufacturer after every 10,000 times of operation.
Accepting standard
Sound level

The sound level shall not exceed 118 dB (A). The total sound pressure level within the band 1800-3550 Hz shall be greater than that of any component of a frequency above 3,550 Hz and in any event equal to or greater than 105 dB (A).
The time lapse between the moment when the device is actuated and the moment when the sound reaches the minimum value prescribed in
above shall not exceed 0.2 second.
Endurance: After performing the endurance test specified above, the sound level shall comply with the requirement specified in
above.
